articles.headline: Army Enlists Anthropology in War Zones
articles.snippet: In an experimental program, anthropologists are paired with American combat units in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.abstract: In an experimental program, anthropologists are paired with American combat units in Afghanistan and Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHABAK VALLEY, Afghanistan — In this isolated Taliban stronghold in eastern Afghanistan, American paratroopers are fielding what they consider a crucial new weapon in counterinsurgency operations here: a soft-spoken civilian anthropologist named Tracy.

articles.headline: Giuliani Pulled No Punches on the Radio
articles.snippet: Former Mayor Rudolph Giuliani often could not contain himself on his radio show while he was New York mayor.
articles.abstract: Former Mayor Rudolph Giuliani often could not contain himself on his radio show while he was New York mayor.
articles.lead_paragraph: So what should a mayor do? Just let constituents call his weekly radio program on WABC — the one called “Live From City Hall ... With Rudy Giuliani” — and whine and complain and get in his face without answering back?

articles.headline: In China, a Rising Star Falters
articles.snippet: The reputation of China Expert Technology suffers as hints of possible fraud emerge.
articles.abstract: The reputation of China Expert Technology suffers as hints of possible fraud emerge.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, investors in a company called China Expert Technology thought they had a winner.

articles.headline: The Venturesome Giant
articles.snippet: In the last few years, G.E. has shown an ever-greater willingness to hook up with other companies, even if it means taking a minority position.
articles.abstract: In the last few years, G.E. has shown an ever-greater willingness to hook up with other companies, even if it means taking a minority position.
articles.lead_paragraph: David R. Nissen, who runs GE Money, remembers how the corporate powers at General Electric used to react whenever the subject of joint ventures came up. “The basic philosophy was, ‘If you don’t have full control, don’t do the deal,’” Mr. Nissen recalled.

articles.headline: Can a Plucky U.S. Economy Surmount $80 Oil?
articles.snippet: As the economy may be starting to sputter from a weak housing market, will $80 oil begin to cause economic pain in a way that it hasn’t in nearly three decades?
articles.abstract: As the economy may be starting to sputter from a weak housing market, will $80 oil begin to cause economic pain in a way that it hasn’t in nearly three decades?
articles.lead_paragraph: Oil prices, an economic scourge in decades past, have soared to record levels in recent years. But the fallout often seemed negligible: Americans kept spending; employment kept growing; factories, construction crews and retail stores stayed busy.

articles.headline: Labels Win Suit Against Song Sharer
articles.snippet: The verdict against a mother of two from Minnesota was a crucial victory for the recording industry in its legal effort to rein in music piracy.
articles.abstract: The verdict against a mother of two from Minnesota was a crucial victory for the recording industry in its legal effort to rein in music piracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a crucial legal victory for record labels and other copyright owners, a federal jury yesterday found a Minnesota woman liable for copyright infringement for sharing music online and imposed a penalty of $222,000 in damages.

articles.headline: Sprint Nextel Is Said to Seek a New Chief
articles.snippet: Many investors have grown increasingly impatient with the company’s less-than-stellar performance, according to people with knowledge of the search.
articles.abstract: Many investors have grown increasingly impatient with the company’s less-than-stellar performance, according to people with knowledge of the search.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sprint Nextel’s board is seeking a new chief executive to burnish the company’s fortunes both on Wall Street and with investors who have grown increasingly impatient with the company’s less-than-stellar performance, according to people apprised of the executive search.
